oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Broad-tailed force distributions and velocity ordering in a heterogeneous membrane model for collective cell migration
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: BAMETA, T
DAS, D
SARKAR, S
DAS, D
INAMDAR, MM
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: MECHANICAL MODEL
BEAD PACKS
FLUCTUATIONS
CULTURE
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Correlated velocity patterns and associated large length-scale transmission of traction forces have been observed in collective live cell migration as a response to a "wound". We argue that a simple physical model of a force-driven heterogeneous elastic membrane sliding over a viscous substrate can qualitatively explain a few experimentally observed facts: i) the growth of velocity ordering which spreads from the wound boundary to the interior; ii) the exponential tails of the traction force distributions; and iii) the swirling pattern of velocities in the interior of the tissue.
